All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AmazonS3Service
This interface provides operations available to Amazon S3.
ApiWebSecurityConfig
This configuration handles api web requests with stateless session.
ApplicationConfig
This class holds application configuration settings for this application.
AuditService
This is the contract for the audit service operations.
AuthRestApi
This class attempt to authenticate with AuthenticationManager bean, add authentication object to SecurityContextHolder then Generate JWT token, then return JWT to client.
AwsProperties
Aws configuration properties groups all properties prefixed with "aws.".
CacheConstants
Constants used in the Cache Maps as keys to the values.
CookieService
Provides mechanism to create and manage cookies.
DatabaseSeeder
A convenient class to initializes and save user data on application start.
DevConfig
This class provides every bean, and other configurations needed to be used in the development phase.
EmailService
Provides operations on sending emails within the application.
EncryptionException
Handles all encryption exceptions for the application.
EncryptionService
This is the contract for the encryption service operations.
ErrorConstants
This class holds all the error messages used in the application.
FileUtils
This utility class holds all operations on I/O operations used in the application.
FormLoginSecurityConfig
This configuration handles form login requests with session.
I18NConfig
Defines the Internationalization configuration.
I18NService
Provides public methods for internationalization.
InvalidFileFormatException
Processes invalidFileFormat exception.
JpaConfig
This class holds JPA configurations for this application.
JwtAuthenticationEntryPoint
This class implements AuthenticationEntryPoint interface.
JwtAuthTokenFilter
This is a filter base class that is used to guarantee a single execution per request dispatch.
JwtService
This is the contract for the jwt service operations.
Loggable
A custom annotation as a pointcut, thus wherever this annotation appears on a method, logging aspect will run around that method execution and log the entry-exit and time taken by that method.
OpenApi30Config
This class holds OpenApi 3 configurations for this application.
OperationStatus
TokenType defines the type of operation status available in the application.
ProdConfig
This class provides every bean, and other configurations needed to be used in the production phase.
ProfileTypeConstants
This class holds all profile type constants used in the application.
RestResponseEntityExceptionHandler
A global exception handler for REST API.
RoleRepository
Repository for the role.
RoleService
Role service to provide implementation for the definitions about a role.
RoleType
Role defines the role to be assigned to each user of the application.
SecurityBean
This class defines the beans needed for the security operation of the application.
SecurityConfig
This class holds security configuration settings from this application.
SecurityUtils
This utility class holds custom operations on security used in the application.
SpringBootStarterApplication
The class has the main method to get the application started.
SuppressSpotBugWarnings
A custom annotation to suppress SpotBugs issues as needed.
SystemProperties
System configuration properties groups all properties prefixed with "system.".
TokenType
TokenType defines the type of tokens supported in the application.
UserHistoryType
UserHistoryType will hold User history types relevant to a user of the application.
UserPruningScheduler
Removes all users not enabled.
UserRepository
Repository for the User.
UserRepositoryRestConfig
Customize the REST configuration for the UserRepository.
UserRestApi
This class handles all rest calls for users.
UserService
This UserService interface is the contract for the user service operations.
UserUtils
User utility class that holds methods used across application.
ValidationUtils
Validation utility holds methods used across application for validation.
WebUtils
This utility class holds all common methods used in the web layer.
